basics.name: Yurkov Sergey 谢尔盖
basics.summary: Experienced researcher in media and communication, data analyst and programmer from Uzbekistan who loves solving problems. Currently based in Suzhou and can start right away.

volunteer.summary: taught graduate students the basics of programming in Python and quantitative analysis

work.name: CSDN
highlights: regularly published tutorials on Python, 华为仓颉, research, and data analysis
attracted > 10,000 readers with > 150 subscribers and > 220 likes

work.name: Fiverr
highlights: developed custom Python applications to help clients with their work and personal needs, such as:
- a shopping list and price comparison app with detailed report to find best deals near a place of residence in Berlin due to recent food price hikes

- an OCR application with a Web UI and the ability to extract keywords from PDFs with machine learning, repair damaged and encrypted files keeping track of changes with a blockchain - tested on thousands of archived documents, and more...
learned to manage complex projects, understand customers’ requirements and enhanced my problem-solving skills

courses: studied media and culture industry in China
focused on computer-mediated and health communication

succeeded in a number of individual projects on topics such as educational value of video games and young adult TV, e-commerce and the rise of consumerism, emerging subcultures among teenagers, the value of the open-source movement, and more

publications.name: applied quantitative research on outcomes of WeChat overuse and stress among university students in China - master thesis
publications.summary: collected psychometric survey data and analyzed it with SmartPLS and JASP; aimed at promoting mental health awareness; received high remarks and interest from the faculty, graded excellent at the time of defense

publications.name: article on “How Uzbek media presents The ‘One Belt, One Road’ Initiative”
publications.summary: case study on media ownership, agenda setting and manipulation of public opinion for political control

publications.name: article titled “Towards effective vaccine communication—a framing analysis of the coverage of vaccines and vaccine-related issues”
publications.summary: wrote a custom scraper with Selenium for the Lexis database; - created a script to sample, sort, and categorize data; used Plotly and Matplotlib to create complex charts; created a custom dashboard with Dash to analyze data

publications.name: study on the Central Asian government’s discourse on China’s involvement in the pandemic in the early stages - pending publication
publications.summary: created a custom social media and news site scraper; developed a custom sentiment analysis pipeline

projects.name: Numcj package - the alternative to Numpy in 仓颉
projects.description: Numcj objective is to recreate Numpy API in Cangjie instead of Python and make it easier to work with arrays in Cangjie Programming Language. The project is a work in progress but already implements a number of functions, includes API documentation, and tests

projects.name: Python OS
projects.description: This project is an attempt to create an OS similar to Commodore KERNAL but running Python instead of BASIC programming language. Includes a TUI written with Textual inspired maintained as a separate project at https://github.com/sergeyyurkov1/pythonui

references.name: arbeitauslagern, Germany
references.reference: absolutely professional work big thanks again for dedicated support

references.name: arbeitauslagern, Germany
references.reference: Professional work big thanks for your support. The result is even better than expected. He really knows what he is doing.
